ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
pyMSER is a Python library that implements the Marginal Standard Error Rule (MSER) to automatically detect the
equilibration period in molecular simulations. It identifies the optimal truncation point where a system
reaches a steady state, ensuring objective and reproducible calculation of thermodynamic properties. By
effectively separating transient data from production data, pyMSER helps reduce computational costs and
improves the accuracy of ensemble averages. The library is designed to be applicable to any time series
analysis requiring steady-state detection, independent of the simulation method.
about.summary: Automatic equilibration detection for molecular simulations using the Marginal Standard Error Rule (MSER)

about.description:
pyMSER is a Python library that implements the Marginal Standard Error Rule (MSER) to automatically detect the
equilibration period in molecular simulations. It identifies the optimal truncation point where a system
reaches a steady state, ensuring objective and reproducible calculation of thermodynamic properties. By
effectively separating transient data from production data, pyMSER helps reduce computational costs and
improves the accuracy of ensemble averages. The library is designed to be applicable to any time series
analysis requiring steady-state detection, independent of the simulation method.
about.summary: Automatic equilibration detection for molecular simulations using the Marginal Standard Error Rule (MSER)

name: pymser
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pymser" %}
{% set version = "1.0.22" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/IBM/pymser/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 1bd71264a347a41f490b6910fc57f54b7eb51fc69f6a10dfec3cead6e6b29444

build:
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - numpy
    - scipy
    - statsmodels
    - pytorch

test:
  imports:
    - pymser
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
  commands:
    - pip check

about:
  home: https://github.com/IBM/pymser
  summary: Automatic equilibration detection for molecular simulations using the Marginal Standard Error Rule (MSER)
  description: |
    pyMSER is a Python library that implements the Marginal Standard Error Rule (MSER) to automatically detect the 
    equilibration period in molecular simulations. It identifies the optimal truncation point where a system 
    reaches a steady state, ensuring objective and reproducible calculation of thermodynamic properties. By 
    effectively separating transient data from production data, pyMSER helps reduce computational costs and 
    improves the accuracy of ensemble averages. The library is designed to be applicable to any time series 
    analysis requiring steady-state detection, independent of the simulation method.
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE
  doc_url: https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/acs.jctc.4c00417
  dev_url: https://https://github.com/IBM/pymser

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - xiki-tempula
